Class: Map

Map

new Map()

This is the Map class. It handles Google Maps API, searching for venues, and plotting markers

Methods

<private> create_infownd()

Create infoWindow overlay. Retrieves information about the tips available for this location, populating the DOM and setting click event handlers for PREV/NEXT buttons. Note there is a limit of 30 tips per call on Foursquare's API. It is possible to expand this number, but not implemented.
Source:
  • src/js/common.js, line 206
See:
  • Underscore.js temoplate documentation

createMarker()

This function create two map markers - one for the shadow, one for the icon. The icon is customized according to venue category on Foursquare (bars, restaurants, party, etc). If venue was found on Foursquare, create click event linked to marker_onClick().
Source:
  • src/js/common.js, line 134
See:
  • {Map#marker_onClick}

initialize()

Creates the map, applies the styling defined above, and add click events
Source:
  • src/js/common.js, line 73

<private> marker_onClick()

Marker Click. When a click on a Marker is received, the information is extracted from Google Maps and passed to create the InfoWindow.
Source:
  • src/js/common.js, line 181

search() → {Object.Deferred}

Search for a specific location, on a radius of config.radius miles around Manhattan, in NY state only.
Source:
  • src/js/common.js, line 104
Returns:
A deferred Promise(), linked to the search result on Google Maps

Object.Deferred
